# Required

- <i class="fas fa-book"></i> [Chapter 3: Data visualization](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/data-visualisation.html)  and [Chapter 5: Data transformation](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/transform.html) in Garrett Grolemund and Hadley Wickham, *R for Data Science* [@WickhamGrolemund:2017]

- <i class="fas fa-book"></i> [Chapter 2: Aesthetic mapping](https://serialmentor.com/dataviz/aesthetic-mapping.html), [Chapter 3: Coordinate systems and axes](https://serialmentor.com/dataviz/coordinate-systems-axes.html), [Chapter 4: Color scales](https://serialmentor.com/dataviz/color-basics.html), and [Chapter 19: Common pitfalls of color use](https://serialmentor.com/dataviz/color-pitfalls.html) in Claus Wilke, *Fundamentals of Data Visualization* [@Wilke:2018]

# Recommended

- <i class="fas fa-external-link-square-alt"></i> [The Science of Information Visualization: A Sketch](https://eagereyes.org/criticism/sketch-of-infovis-science) by Robert Kosara.

- <i class="fas fa-external-link-square-alt"></i> [What is visualization research? What should it be?](https://medium.com/multiple-views-visualization-research-explained/what-is-visualization-research-what-should-it-be-8840a9ba658) by Jessica Hullman (Multiple Views Blog)
